thread.title: Donald Trump wants to expand US nuclear arsenal, make it 'top of the pack'
thread.title_full: Donald Trump wants to expand US nuclear arsenal, make it 'top of the pack'

author: Steve Holland
title: Donald Trump wants to expand US nuclear arsenal, make it 'top of the pack'
text:
Donald Trump wants to expand US nuclear arsenal, make it 'top of the pack' Steve Holland twitter TWEET More 
Washington: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he wants to build up the US nuclear arsenal to ensure it is at the "top of the pack," saying the United States has fallen behind in its atomic weapons capacity. 
In a Reuters interview, Trump also complained about Russian deployment of a cruise missile in violation of an arms control treaty and said he would raise the issue with Russian President Vladimir Putin when and if they meet. Scientists have moved the hands of their metaphorical 'Doomsday' clock closer to midnight, warning of the increasing threats of nuclear weapons and climate change. Hundreds demonstrate in front of the White House after President Donald Trump's administration revoked guidelines on transgender bathrooms. Up Next US commitment to NATO reaffirmed Play Video US commitment to NATO reaffirmed US commitment to NATO reaffirmed 
The US remains committed to the NATO alliance and will work to help it face upcoming security challenges says Joseph Dunford, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Up Next Politics collide over Jakarta floods Play Video Politics collide over Jakarta floods Politics collide over Jakarta floods 
Severe flooding in Jakarta as a result of torrential rain, overflowing rivers and poor urban infrastructure could become the deciding factor in upcoming elections Up Next Pastor felt 'demonic' behaviour at Trump rally Play Video Pastor felt 'demonic' behaviour at Trump ... Pastor felt 'demonic' behaviour at Trump rally 
Anger, vengeance and "religious zeal" are the feelings President Donald Trump stirred up as his returned to the campaign trail, says Orlando Pastor Joel Tooley. Up Next Trump revokes Obama guidelines on transgender bathrooms Play Video Trump revokes Obama guidelines on ... Trump revokes Obama guidelines on transgender bathrooms 
Protesters gather near the White House, angry over the Trump administration's revoking guidance to public schools in defense of transgender student rights. Up Next Californian spillway dazzles after heavy rain Play Video Californian spillway dazzles after heavy ... Californian spillway dazzles after heavy rain 
Heavy storms in the US have brought water to the famous Glory Hole spillway at California's Monticello Dam, but the rain has wreaked havoc elsewhere in nearby San Jose. Up Next Workers save girl hanging from building Play Video Workers save girl hanging from building Workers save girl hanging from building 
Two men scale the fourth storey of a building to rescue a girl hanging by the neck in a burglar grille in the city of Meizhou, in south China's Guangzhou Province. More videos The world is moving closer to catastrophic peril, scientists say 
Scientists have moved the hands of their metaphorical 'Doomsday' clock closer to midnight, warning of the increasing threats of nuclear weapons and climate change. 
On another front, Trump said China could solve the national security challenge posed by North Korea "very easily if they want to," ratcheting up pressure on Beijing to exert more influence to rein in Pyongyang's increasingly bellicose actions. 
Speaking from behind his desk in the Oval Office, Trump also declared himself "very angry" at North Korea's ballistic missile tests and said accelerating a missile defence system for US allies Japan and South Korea was among many options available. Related Content
